website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy machine with plenty of variety for most users and a relatively low cost.
pros: 50 exercises in a compact, quality unit
cons: Might have to upgrade the resistance if 210 lbs
Resistance rods lose resistance over time

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, works great for toning and light strengthing.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, this is a great machine for toning and strengthening muscle groups. I bought this to help my lower back and it is great for this. It is not for a serious body builder as the weight does not go high enough but for most who want to get in better condition at home it works quite well. I'm very happy with it. I used to life quite heavily and run marathons/triathlons but with a lower back injury and pinched nerve those days are behind me. This helps to keep me in shape and give me relief from the pain. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: diver64

customer_reviews.title: arrived promptly ... good shape .. seems to do as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my wife ... she loves it ... so far so good ... no one has started hanging clothes on it
customer_reviews.author: David Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good assembly experience
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to throw in a thumbs up for the ease of assembly, and clear directions. I admit, I was a little nervous that the task might get out of hand, but it ended up being pretty easy. It took about three hours, by myself, and that includes unpacking everything and getting it organized. Nothing was too difficult to handle alone. Great experience!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: The digital component keeps malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: What can best be described as the unit's CPU keeps shutting down. It finally stopped working. Bowflex sent me a new CPU and it still will not turn on. The unit, itself, is decent. The cables keep slipping, which disrupts resistance, but it performs its job adequately. But I did not pay $1800 for an adequate cable machine. I am getting the run around from customer service and am thoroughly disappointed in Bowflex and Nautilus.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fake news
customer_reviews.text: The only way you'll get 210lbs of resistance from this thing is moving the box into your house. Good news is it's easy to assemble, and then disassemble to return.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: A Pain to switch around cables to the pulleys.
customer_reviews.text: Way over priced. Worth 400.00 tops. A pain to switch exercises because of the cables and pulleys. It’s been years since I worked out. Was curious too see if I could bench the full 210 pounds... six times no problem. Made me question the actual resistance of the rods. The booklet they give is a pain to look up how to do the exercises...they should include a poster or something of that nature. I’ve already sweat stained the booklet. Like all us consumers, we go through the pain of assembling such products that we are discouraged to take it apart and box it up neatly for a return. Save yourself some money and get some free weights.
customer_reviews.author: Marshal Letchworth

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Home Gym. Great Results
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic home gym. Especially considering the price. I'm not terribly handy but I set it up with no issues. The workouts are fantastic. I was a little skeptical at first but I read the reviews, and gave it s a shot Am amazed by the burn and the results. And the range of exercises is way more than I thought. I was also impresses with the leg extensions (I wasn't expecting much for that particular execise and it's good). The only oddity is the bench but you figure it out and make the most of it. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KT729

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Super goo deal. I’ve bought 3 in my life and this is the best deal to date.
customer_reviews.author: SIXM6N

customer_reviews.title: It's a project
customer_reviews.text: Took 4 hours and $200 to assemble, 2 hours another $200 to disassemble. Too many moving parts to change to switch exercise. You can step on lots of pulleys and parts. Takes way too much space when the fangs open up. The resistance based training using synthetic material is no match to free weights. Too much going on for too little as one spend most of the time figuring out which cable goes with which hook.
customer_reviews.author: Daniyal Hameed

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Got his after years of going to the gym. Noticeable results in just a few weeks of using it. While there aren't as many exercise options as a full sized gym has, the Xceed packs a lot of exercises into a small foot print, and will wear you out. Great home gym, wish I would have invested in it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Ack

customer_reviews.text: I GAINED 50 POUNDS AFTER I BOUGHT THIS PIECE OF CRAP!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: It's quite a complex item but the quality of the instructions and the packaging of the small parts are fantastic. The end result does what it's supposed to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an object lesson to every company selling something you have to put together. It's quite a complex item but the quality of the instructions and the packaging of the small parts are fantastic. The end result does what it's supposed to effectively The price was good. I'd recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Was easier to put together than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Although it took some time, I was able to put this together with a friend's help. I found it difficult to follow the handbook for exercises - it keeps switching from the upper bands to the lower bands. But I figured out how to do the exercises with some logic.
customer_reviews.author: Mags

customer_reviews.title: For regular folks who just want to do strength training for fitness this machine is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: The Blaze works very well. Yes you have to make changes to the power rods for different resistance for different exercises which take longer than traditional gym stack machines, but it is no big deal. I just structure my workout around each pulley and do all the planned exercises with each one then move on to the next one. There is a lot more down time in the gym just waiting for a machine. Plus all the sweat I encounter is my own (or my from my wife). For regular folks who just want to do strength training for fitness this machine is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: William L Schwed

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t even have the basics
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t even have a vertical sit down bench, only one at an angle, so no doing shoulders, you can’t do a sit down bench press either, these are two very basic exercises that any machine should be able to do, look at the pictures carefully when they are doing shoulders, there is nothing behind her back at all, also it doesn’t include basic accessories for you to do a lot of exercises with, ridiculous... I would highly recommend going with a different model
customer_reviews.author: Will W

customer_reviews.title: One of the best investments.
customer_reviews.text: It's been more than 12 years since I bought this home gym and it has not disappointed me. The elastic power rods are still performing well and have not shown any sign of deterioration yet. Just be sure to tie them together after each use. Installation was not very hard although it may take a few hours if you are doing it the first time. This home gym has not rusted one bit and the paint hasn't peeled off at all. Definitely a great investment for your health to keep you in shape. It is relatively cheap compared to other home gym systems.
customer_reviews.author: GGSM Mobile

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Absolute JUNK. Took FOREVER to get here. Came all banged up and scratched. Rods were pre worn. The instructions to put together were horrible and hard to follow parts were not labeled at all. Once put together the whole seat shook as its a cheap product the length of movement made almost all workouts impossible and I'm only 5'11". And a huge inconvenience to change between work outs you have to rehook all the cables back up. DO NOT BUY. NOW i've been in a constant battle to get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Not a big long review here, just wanted to make sure my opinion was heard. This machine has been life changing. I am so glad I did not second guess my decision to purchase. I love the bar above the head and that the seat is removable. We already have a lay down bench so i wasn't worried about that. This thing takes up almost no space at all and had helped me build some major muscles.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Pski

customer_reviews.title: Favorite full gym
customer_reviews.text: The best! The only form of exercise I like and believe in is weight training, but bowflex makes that much more enjoyable than lifting free weights. The weight is easily adjustable and I can do 5-6 different exercises without changing much. I do mostly lower body workouts because as a woman those are our problem areas. I am seeing big results just a month after using bowflex, and I was in a good shape to begin with. My husband also loves it for upper body workouts, and says it’s fun and safe for him even post back surgery. With bowflex we have a complete home gym in our garage so this investment was definitely worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Aliens

customer_reviews.title: One month into the workout and we love it more with each day
customer_reviews.text: One month into the workout and we love it more with each day. Next is BowFlex M5. The resistance training is much easier on the joints and my body is taking a very nice shape without bulky muscles. I have dropped 18lbs with healty eating habbits and every day 30 minutes workout in just 5 weeks. Setup was pretty easy in just few hours i did it myself. Thus far i could not be happier. Quality is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Amz_Reviewer1

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece of equipment. Watch your fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this piece. Not too heavy, versatile but I've hurt myself so many times just getting around it! Pinching my skin, tripping over parts... There is no place to store lower cables that seem to get in the way. The set up is not bad but if you follow the YouTube video, mind that in steep 10 (I think) the assemblers install the pulleys facing the wrong direction. The manual indicates otherwise. You need some attachments to do some crunches. The belt provided is not good enough. Overall, it is a very good and affordable strength machine for beginners. If you lift or squat over 100 lbs however, this is not the one for you
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but several broken plastic pieces
customer_reviews.text: Several plastic pieces were broken. The square tube the leg exerciser slides into has a plastic sleeve inside ad it was broke and pushed down in opening so I couldn’t even slide the leg attachment in it.
customer_reviews.author: zack

customer_reviews.title: Impractical workout machine
customer_reviews.text: The machine is well-made and very sturdy. The leg attachment is dangerous and should not be used in any case. The rest of the machine is interesting but completely impractical. There is too much to do between exercises which mix for a much less efficient workout. And the final answer about this machine is that mine is now in the trash waiting to be hauled away. I wanted to like it, but it just doesn't work for me. Seriously consider something that is more flexible and you will use in a more efficient way.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I've been lifting for close to twenty years now, and have collected a few injuries along the way. This machine is a dream come true: I can get a great workout in that's really easy on my joints. I especially love the lack of momentum and successively increased resistance the further you pull. Basically every motion becomes harder at the full range of motion and produces an amazing "flex" or load on your muscles, again, without wrecking your joints. You're also less prone to locking out at the "top" of a movement, so no "door-slam-hinge" effect.
customer_reviews.author: Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and easy to be consistent with my lifting
customer_reviews.text: It is so nice to have an in-home gym finally. I haven't had a convenient gym for the last couple of years, and it was definitely hurting my swimming and other workouts. Now I can lift 3 times a week and have been fine-tuning the sequence of my workouts to minimize setup changes. It's nice to be getting back some of the muscle tone I lost with the 2 years off from gym workouts!
customer_reviews.author: W Mike Berke

customer_reviews.title: Talk about heavy and solidly built, this describes the ...
customer_reviews.text: Talk about heavy and solidly built, this describes the Bowflex. Just finished putting it together and will be testing it to see how much I can abuse my body. No, I'm not a muscle freak. Too many surgeries on my back, knees, and shoulders. Needed to try to maintain some sort of exercise because of lack of playing normal activities. This will take some time to assemble and takes up a large amount of space if putting it in a room, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must Own Entry-Level Gym
customer_reviews.text: The BowFlex PR1000 is a must own if you want to stay in shape or tone up. Like many, I wanted to tone up when CoViD ended the world in March and closed all the gyms. This is an excellent entry-level home gym for its price. Easy to assemble and quite versatile. I have been using it for almost 3 months now and am seeing excellent results; perhaps even better results than going to the gym because I can really concentrate on form and my reps. Great job BowFlex. I plan on being a lifelong customer.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy build
customer_reviews.text: Got it yesterday built it and used it in the same evening. Just didn't realize at the time when I bought it I could not upgrade the weight. Still great piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Robert O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: My wife wanted this
customer_reviews.text: So My wife was adamant that she wanted this SO I bought it for her and assembled it for her It has been in the back room now for 4 weeks, She is yet to use it. The flex's on it will I guess make great coat hangers.
customer_reviews.author: Bfek.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this and loves it. He had problems with his sciatica and even went to PT for it. After the PT was done he was needing something and we got this, since using it, he’s not hurting as much and he’s got even more pep in his step compared to when he was done with PT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need paint color name
customer_reviews.text: Boxes came in beat up and opened and the power rods where all scuffed up also the greyish metalic parts have paint chips . I’d really like to know what the grey color is called so I can touch it up smh last review I tried posting was denied so I’m hoping this one goes through .
customer_reviews.author: icemilwaukee76

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Completed set up this morning, alone, no power tools. Only the ones that came with and pliers to hold locknuts while tightening. If you are vertically challenged, like myself, be sure to have a safe step stool for mounting the top part of the mainframe. I am only 5’3” and struggled until I grabbed stool. I didn’t time it as I had to take breaks in between. The main purpose for my purchase is to get myself back Into shape. I did a few basic trials after set up and and impressed at the comfort. Looking forward to improving my over all well being.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Confusing to begin
customer_reviews.text: I found the Bowflex Home Gym challenging to begin work out routine. The requirement to connect and disconnect things for the different workouts takes some time to learn. I think Bowflex should provide some online videos on a quick start exercise routine. Assembly was not quick, it took over 2 hours to fully assemble.
customer_reviews.author: FrankO

customer_reviews.title: Damaged parts and no support
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, had badly damaged foam rollers and nasty scratched part, attempted to contact support in writing - via email to suggest a single replacement part and new foam pieces, nobody responded within the last several days. If nobody responds within next week we're planning on dismanteling and returning.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Z

customer_reviews.title: Home Gym damage
customer_reviews.text: The Bowflex PR3000 arrived yesterday and we set it up in our basement. The box in which the home gym arrived was quite banged up but upon opening everything seemed to be ok. However, as we started putting the gym together we noticed that practically every piece had scratches, scuff marks, etc. We are unsure whether we got a used gym (we most certainly hope this is not the case!), whether it was damaged in delivery (unlikely, as each part had some markings) or whether the quality of production was sub par (most likely). We have lots of pictures detailing the damage and will try to post them later on.
customer_reviews.author: O. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: As long as you have patience and follow the assembly instructions it’s all good! Was intimidated when I first looked at all the parts out of the box but it took me about 60 minutes (by myself) to put it together. You do have to change cables and attachments for different exercises but that’s how it’s designed
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Solid Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: Ok. I’ve wanted a home gym for years. Never pulled the plug bc of cost. But, since we’ve been quarantined, we decided to pull the trigger. Pros Home gym right in front of you. Safe from the Rona Tons of exercises Not that big, fits in our extra bedroom Fluid motion Constant tension Comes with attachments Cons The only issue I have is that it takes about 10 secs to either change exercises or tension. It’s not as fluid as doing exercises in a gym. Just something to get used to.
customer_reviews.author: E. Yesser

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: My husband (81 years old) has been using a Bowflex for many years, his last one was used so much, he works out every day, the pull bars started to break off. When this happened he knew a new one was needed. It wasn't too hard to put together as all the parts are clearly marked. Even at our age, we had it together in a few hours. This one has many more features and is pleasing to the eye.
customer_reviews.author: Constance Zecchin

customer_reviews.title: Straps do NOT work
customer_reviews.text: The straps that come in the hardware package that you have to use for the squat bar are useless! The teeth do not hold it in place so when you stand up the strap loosens and it has no tension. I called and got replacements. Still doesn't work. So it makes the squat bar useless. If you want to spend the money and really only want upper body the rest of the machine is good. I really wanted squats but husband likes upper body.
customer_reviews.author: SKB

customer_reviews.title: decent but has some flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Every exercise requires rerouting the cables and pulleys. To use the leg machine u uave to disconnect the lat bar and connect the lef cables to the pulleys. Its an inconvenience but not too big a deal. Overall a decent machine, the tension rods dont allow for a full range of motion on many of the exercises either. Definitely would have purchased something else had i know all this. But its still decent for the price
customer_reviews.author: jacob kitchens

customer_reviews.title: Dumb bells are better
customer_reviews.text: As far as over all health it's not bad but not very great! The power rods are not very accurate and you don't get maximum resistance until three quarters through the rep. I would highly recommend getting an adjustable bench and a good set of dumb bells instead of this.
customer_reviews.author: Cuffem311

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it. Weight bars are not true weight. Time consuming to change cables and pulleys for different exercises. Like so many other Bowflex products this is a total waste of money. Invest in a good set of free weights and a cage and be happy. Don't buy this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi K.

customer_reviews.title: Very Good System Overall and a Great Value at this Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality, fairly versatile, moderately easy to assemble system whose only flaw so far is that it is a bit imposing and time consuming for a beginning or novice user. As with all systems like this, it takes a lot of time to learn how to set-up for each exercise, how to quickly transition from one to the next, and develop a routine that not only meets your workout needs but is simultaneously optimally sequenced to minimize transition time so you're not spending most of your time doing equipment changes instead of working out. So, it is a system that should get better and better with time and familiarity. For the price, it is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Two Zero

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good machine. I ponied up and purchased this right before SHTF with COVID. I'm glad I did. I'm in my 30s, and in above average physical shape. If you focus on the mind/muscle connection and work movements slowly, you will definitely get a great workout with this machine. That said, this machine is not geared to powerlifters or serious bodybuilders, but will build muscle for fit people. The only exercise that I can't replicate well with this machine are squats. That was to be expected, obviously. All in all, I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cavali

customer_reviews.title: It is what is advertised
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived. Fairly easy to assemble. I have been using it for a week. I wish that there was clips for the cables that you are not using but that is really not an issue. I had an issue with the seat not sitting exactly where it should but once again very minor. If you want an easy to use workout machine for the house it should do the trick
customer_reviews.author: K. Macaulay

customer_reviews.title: Bowflex PR3000 much better than the old 80s model.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Bowflex PR3000 for the upright workout position and not needing cable changes. Having owned a late 80s Bowflex and a original Weider Crossbow unit, I find that while both of these units were good in their own way, the Bowflex PR3000 is markedly superior with its design. Assembly was straight forward with the only a slight hick-up with cable/pulley system. I didn't pay enough attention and had to redo a section. I wish Bowflex would include posters with the different exercises on them like previous models. I would certainly recommend this unit to anyone, especially if they can get it on one of the sales.
customer_reviews.author: C A

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this machine
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm very surprised and pleased. Thought I would miss the weight stack system I used to have but loving this machine. Forces you to do full range motion and very smooth and quiet. Lots of excersie options. A lot to put together but it all fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: FPS

customer_reviews.title: I've been censored
customer_reviews.text: Great product, takes up small space, and a lot of exercises can be done. I like it. Now, onto the service end of this...well, I've already written an honest and accurate review on my experience regarding the delivery, and it was rejected by Amazon. I'm not able to talk about my blank blank experience. In other words I can not be fully truthful. Suffice it to say mumm is the word. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine!  Lots of exercise options so you don’t get bored.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and have been using this since this past October. I’ve been pretty consistent with my workouts, thankfully! It’s help me slim down and lose a few pounds, and has given me a bit of definition in my arms. I definitely don’t look like the models that use this, but I’ve been very happy with it so far. I’m thankful that there are many different exercises you can do with it so you don’t become bored with it. Setting it up was fairly simple, and once I got the hang of how to run all the cords I can quickly change between each exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Adam M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent work out
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for just about every type of exercise I used to need a gym full of equipment to do. With a little creativity, you get full upper, core and lower body exercises with very few exceptions, and the resistance style is a different type of burn than what you get with weight stacks, in a good way. My only complaint is that the "rowing" functionality isn't that great.
customer_reviews.author: GTC

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Blaze for about 6 months now. Well built but a little rickety with heavier weights. Takes up more room than you expect. You will need a 6'x10' space. Do buy the extra rod kit. Also buy an extra set of hand grips for curls. I have found that I can leave every thing hooked up so I don't have to reconfigure everything when I change exercises. Works best for lighter weights with more reps. For heavier lifting, free weights would be better. I am happy with the purchase and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: C-19 kicked me out of my local gym/pool so I bought this to stay in shape until the world returns to normal. I bought the Blaze as it seemed to have the most utility for the $800 range gyms. Most of my training was in the pool and I am able to create cable workouts with my Bowflex that simulate most of my swimming. Assembled by my self slowly and carefully. It took 2.5 hours to build. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Rell

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Scratched
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Xceed to complement my elliptical since I’ve been wanting a Bowflex for years. I was so sad to see a long scratch in a highly conspicuous area (lat tower) and even sadder yet since it was the last piece to assemble. I would have sent it back but the machine is now fully assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Gerri

customer_reviews.title: Excellent home gym.
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality solid piece of machinery. As such, it was a little difficult to put together by myself. But I like this type of resistance much better than a weight system. There are many more exercises that can be done on this than I will ever do but the basic ones shown on the included wall chart are fine for now. I’ve already felt and seen an improvement after only two months of general conditioning exercises three times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Dogman

customer_reviews.title: Simple low resistance anaerobic machine, small footprint.
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot of bells and whistles. I can’t use heavy resistance due to a number of orthopedic injuries to spine but I am able to safely isolate numerous muscle groups for upper body. The rowing function is dinky and I don’t use it other than for toe lifts, I’d be happier if there was a seated hamstring isolated exercise, but for money, this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Epador

customer_reviews.title: Small footprint, lots of exercise
customer_reviews.text: Ease of assembly - less complicated than plant stands I've encountered. For a machine with moving parts, quite simple. I'm not a bodybuilder, I don't need a lot of weight to stay toned, just routine. This is perfect for that. It's in my home office. Work in, work out. When I'm ready for the latter, I put away my desk chair and unfold the Bowflex. 30 minutes every other day. If your focus is legs, this is ok, but if you're working on a press get a barbell and weights. Otherwise a great purchase, totally worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L. Crooke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: OK. I'm a very handy person. I can put anything together. This took me about four hours to assemble. You can do it. Just focus. I am so pleased with this home gym. I get a very good workout. A ton of exercises you can do on it. Less stress on my joints. Free weights where killing my wrist. I'm getting buffer as I write this review.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R.

customer_reviews.title: Bowflex Machine is great for seniors!
customer_reviews.text: The Bowflex PR1000 is just right for me. I am a senior male and have done workouts for most of my life. The Bowflex is so easy to use and I can do all my exercises right in my home. I recommend this unit. It is a high-quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Dapper Dan

customer_reviews.title: Complete trash
customer_reviews.text: Not a commercial product and not a sufficient substitute for any equipment at the gym. You will get 40% of the workout using this pile of trash than you would get using commercial equipment at the gym. This machine should be a last resort for someone desperate to do exercise with no other options.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: NOT EASY TO ASSEMBLE
customer_reviews.text: Said it was easy to assemble but upon opening box (144 lbs.) and starting to look at all parts, I realized there was no way it was easy. Some pieces were very heavy and there were endless parts, screws, bolts, straps, etc. I didn't even attempt to get past the first stand piece. To pay for assembly is too expensive. Put all that I had taken out (no all pieces and parts) back and am paying TOO MUCH for the return, but at least I can return it. I will search for one locally that is used but assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good home equipment, very durable
customer_reviews.text: This product allows isolation exercises for almost all muscle groups. I actually bought this 6 years ago, just adding a review. It has seen a lot of use, have had no issues. Occasionally have to tighten a bolt, that's it. This is not "weight", it's resistance. That being said, the 210 lbs it comes with is not enough for a fit adult man, or even teenage male or strong woman, especially with bench press, leb lifts or triceps work. I upgraded to the 410 lb. It's enough for most exercises. That being said, it's very flexible, can easily change resistance to accommodate varying strength levels. It's great for solo workout, you don't need a spotter.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Package arrived early and it was what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The seller delivered the product two days earlier than expected. The pr1000 is definitely better than using resistance bands when you can’t go to the gym. There are some limitations for certain exercises. However there are way more exercises than shown in manual and if you have experience like me about 16 years of weight training at the gym this beats about every other option unless you have space and money to buy the amount of free weights you would need to do the available exercises. You can upgrade this machine with simple modifications which I recommended because 210 is not enough for me unless I want to do 20 reps every set.
customer_reviews.author: gvt

customer_reviews.title: Lovin it
customer_reviews.text: I used to workout faithfully at the gym, then covid. I tried many home workout programs but did not get the workout I needed. So I brought a BowFlex. So glad I did, this is a versatile machine that gives me a solid workout. I know its expensive but your health is worth it. Can't beat the price on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Happy Workouts
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleased to find this model. I used the same one for 10 years but gave it away when I moved. So happy to be working out again. Good quality and easy to assemble..
customer_reviews.author: Cathyann

customer_reviews.title: home gym
customer_reviews.text: bow flex home gym , assembly is easy . don't tighten the bolts until assembly is almost complete. tighten the bottom when complete. then the top .if you have a drill you can save some time by buying the right size bit driver for assembly . the owners manual tells you which pulley to hook up to . check your cables if you are having difficulty on an exercise . amazon was prompt on shipping . would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: There are many different exercises. Setting it up takes a few hours but straight forward.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best investments I’ve made. I’ve been using it for about two months now and can already see the results. There are many different exercises that I can do for the whole body. It is sturdy and made of good quality. The folding option is great because it helps save a lot of space when not in use. Good gym and perfect for beginner to intermediate gym enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: syed a mehdi

customer_reviews.title: The right kind of gym for the right kind of person.
customer_reviews.text: Is this the greatest home gym ever? No. Do I have to go to the gym, wait for the bros that are doing more talking and flexing to finish their 'set' so I can work out? No. Does it do everything I need it to? Yes, I had to adapt my workout a little but, yes it does. It fits in the basement of my townhouse and I can workout on my schedule. You're never going to get 'ripped' on this thing but if you're really in it for general fitness and want convenience this product is great.
customer_reviews.author: M_H

customer_reviews.title: Xceed your expectations....
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get a great product with a modest budget. This unit is definitely the best valje for your money. I purchased the XCEED and separately got the 310 and 410 upgrades. Super easy to assemble, and i only needes help with one piece. Took maybe 3 hours and doing it very carefully and slowly (no rush). It comes with pretty much anything you need to do all exercises. The box did arrived like someone took it on dirt and rocky roads until it made to my house. Very happy that we got this unit
customer_reviews.author: DA TEMP

customer_reviews.title: Beware, this is not sold from Bowflex.
customer_reviews.text: When I received this order the delivery guy made a point of saying how this must have been in the warehouse a long time because it was covered with dust and dirt. The box was ripped open several places and the strofoam was falling out of the box on my floor. After opening the box and looking at all the pieces I found the Upper lat tower was all scratched up. Not that it will hinder the performance of the machine. But, for the price I paid I would expect this to be free from ANY damage. I think I should get a partial refund because of the damage, pls see photo.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. Aschoff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This Bowflex has been the perfect machine to help me to rehab a torn rotator cuff. Plus I am using it to regain my strength. I took the manual to my physical therapist and he highlighted the exercises I needed to concentrate on. My overall strength is improving and I am starting to see definite results. It really has helped.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Great Workout
customer_reviews.text: I have been working out in the gym for over 50 years and this machine works. I benched 345(smith machine so a little cheat) at age 60 so I am no lightweight. The review that says you may have just used rubber bands in its place is bogus and without a doubt a review from a competitor. Took about 2 hours to setup the machine out of the box. Easy to change between exercises. Only drawback is there is a limited motion for some exercises. Standing arm curls do not have full range of motion. A small squat makes it a little better. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Chester M Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Great Home Gym!
customer_reviews.text: I looooove the Bowflex Home Gym. This product is great if you are looking for a weighted system in order to get into shape. It comes with a book of all sorts of different exercises that you can do with it, which really helps in case you are unsure of what you can do with it. I've had it for 3 weeks and can already see an improvement from using it. When you receive it, I will admit there are a LOT of pieces to put together. But just for the record, I'm a female and I put it together in one night on my own. (May want to use your own tools).
customer_reviews.author: tcrew85

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I agree with some reviews. Took forever to deliver. Full of scratches. Most parts are made of cheap plastic. I want heavier resistance rods. A lot of parts like plastic caps and screws that I don’t know where they go although the equipment is already assembled. Hopefully it’s not going to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: bright girl

customer_reviews.title: Give yourself a raise, get the local wholesale brand
customer_reviews.text: The ties are no good, seat keeps coming off - this is no better than cheaper generic brand local wholesale store product. Instructions which come with the product to put it together is not clear, waste!
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Have been lifting free weights for 30 years and I love this bowflex
customer_reviews.text: I have been using for 60 days. Very happy with purchase. Solid machine, built well. Have been working out for 30+ years with free weights. Now I am mixing up my workouts with the Bowflex and free weights. Love the Bowflex because you don't have to worry about a spotter, the 310 lbs is great for bench flys and other chest exercises, bicep and tricip work. At some point will probably need to go to 410 but mixing it up provide a great workout for next 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: gottaread

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It works great! My son uses it most every day and loves it. If you are into pounding on the weights, and getting huge, this might not be for since total weight per side only goes up to 105 lbs. But if you are trying to get in shape, build muscle and definition this is a great machine as long as you aren't trying to look like Arnold Schwarzenegger.
customer_reviews.author: Rivqah

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but the nuts are very tight.
customer_reviews.text: The best workout I had is by tightening the nuts. They are ridiculously tight due to the plastic lining inside the nut. It took 3 hours to assemble (with some rework). The equipment is very sturdy. I would have given 5 stars if I don't have to put extra effort for the nuts. I'll start my workout and update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Zigbee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: This replaces a Bow flex (same model) that was purchased used 9 yrs ago. Put this together myself, a little over 2 hrs. Directions are VERY easy to follow. The booklet includes at lot of workouts and helped me put together a new routine. Cables and rods were wore out on the old one, like this new machine, glad I purchased it. Felt the price wasn’t too bad, couldn’t find this model on their site.
customer_reviews.author: K. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: If you like pumping iron, hear the banging of metal plates, the yelling, and are into the whole fitness center atmosphere, this fitness machine is not for you. But if you want a quiet, complete workout on your own schedule at home, here's the machine that will keep you toned up. It is easy to assemble, but will take some time. Two people are better than one for assembly, but I did okay by myself. The one thing you need to remember, the maximum resistance is 210 pounds, which is plenty for most folks.
customer_reviews.author: Gene in W2, WA

customer_reviews.title: Hoping we get some help
customer_reviews.text: Just bought and while unpacking see that the bench seat has two giant slices on it. Not happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia L. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a VERY heavy box! I paid for the delivery just inside my door. Then, I brought just a few pieces at a time up the stairs to the excersize room. Got a workout just doing that! We assembled it is under an hour. We are very happy with it. You can get a thorough workout on this machine!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbhe

customer_reviews.title: It is worth it for the price I recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for working out at home it’s compact. It was not too bad assembling. Only thing is you have to switch cables with different exercises but once you get used to it it’s not that big of a deal. For the price it is definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Would probably be a good machine if the seat would stay on.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Bowflex Xceed a little over a month ago. My seat will not stay on. I bought this for chest workouts. I am not able to use this machine. I’ve tried to contact Bowflex or Nautilus several times. All I do is set on hold and never get a return email! It’s a joke! I have a metal ornament in my living room. That’s all it’s good for at this point. Frustrated is an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Waited too long....Time to hit the GYM😎
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase I have ever made! My Own personal Gym 💪at home.. great for people who can't go to a actual gym.... having this at is the best thing ever plus it's a great addition to my dumbbells. You might want to buy the additional retention upgrade bar 310-410. it is worth your money the retention bars work great. Update 3 weeks into it still satisfied. No more excuses......
customer_reviews.author: NO_Peace

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I look like the girl in that picture now, except I'm a dude, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Padre Freddie

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality.  Does a great job to help you get into shape
customer_reviews.text: I like the many options you have to exercise many different parts of your body, but especially the upper body exercises, because the leg or curl exercises seem to be too inconvenient to change up cables so much. There is an inconvenience factor to switch from upper body to lower body exercises, unless you do "rowing" which still uses the front facing cable apparatus.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: I love this product I love this product I use it ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this product I love this product I use it every day I've lost 23 pounds in six weeks in conjunction with my new flex belt and a new diet I couldn't be happier. After a back surgery in 2000 I have been unable to get to the gym or lift anything superheavy so this is a perfect alternative and if I get too tired I can just let go no harm no foul
customer_reviews.author: Kremdulvo

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware... read why
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy because it was a 1 box delivery and not a single item was categorized by letter or number. A nightmare to install based on tiny pictures of the items. With 100 pieces to assemble they could of AT LEAST put part letters or numbers for easy assembly. Took me 2 hours just to separate the parts and screws and STILL don't know what goes where. I loved it before I received it. Horrible purchase
customer_reviews.author: david santana

customer_reviews.title: Wow... very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Just trying to get back into the groove and this machine is built perfectly. While not "easily" upgradable as the others, this one will provide plenty for a long time before a "hack" is needed. However, I did have one pulley that is dried out, making noise, and sticking. I have called and emailed for a replacement... we will see how long that takes. Four stars because of this.
customer_reviews.author: J2daEWW

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Handled this Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived exactly as promised, they even brought it into my home, was in excellent shape, went together easily, not one item damaged or missing, now for the fun times and years of working out. Thanks Blowflex for the quality Gym and thanks Amazon for getting it to me safely!
customer_reviews.author: Abovereproach

customer_reviews.title: Very substantial well built product and great value
customer_reviews.text: Only took an hour to build, easy instructions and bubble pack hardware. Very well made and easy to use. Getting used to exercise routine to tone up. Fold up feature keeps it out of the way when not in use. Great value at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: A versatile home gym for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Blaze so that I could upgrade to 410 lbs. If you intend to stick with the standard 210 lb setup, I would recommend the PR1000 to save a few bucks (although there are more workout options with the Blaze, so check out both options). If you think you may want to upgrade (but aren't sure), I would purchase the Blaze. This is a great home gym and I've been using it for two years now. Pros: Upgrade to 410 lbs if desired, lots of workouts, quiet. Cons: Lower body workouts aren't the greatest, assembly was a time vampire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy Home Gym !!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine to have something to use in between when I could not make it to the gym due to time challenges. Assembly was pretty simple and straightforward. As it turns out I use this machine a lot more than anticipated I really like it you can get a very good workout on it. If you are going to use it to gain muscle mass I would definitely get the extra weight rods. I ordered them with the machine and I'm so glad I did.Great Home Gym . Great price for all the functionality
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful unit
customer_reviews.text: This Bowflex is perfect for getting in shape and staying there. Since it is based on resistance, you can adjust accordingly and develop tone and strength with less possibility of injury. I recommend getting an additional set of hand grips to reduce changes. I drilled holes in the device holders to hang the leg extension cables and extra hand grips. If you’re looking for an inexpensive gym to have at home, this is the way to go. I’m 59, 160 lbs. and feeling great!
customer_reviews.author: Kayaker

customer_reviews.title: I Love My Bowflex Blaze
customer_reviews.text: The different exercises you can do with the Blaze is amazing. Basically has four sets of pulleys to set up the power rods. The user's manual is clear and helped me develop several exercise routines. The resistance provided is different from dead weights but is effective if you follow directions. Quality materials and design. Easy to assemble. I really do love it.
customer_reviews.author: catch1949

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: The base unit could be weighted a little better, as the bench portion weights just as much and you can easily tip the base when raising the bench for storage. Placing a foot on the base plate prevents this, tho. Otherwise, I am rather pleased with it. Great addition to my home gym at a very reasonable price that will easily pay for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Wish I had bought it before Christmas because it was $100 cheaper on sale. Stores easily flat against the wall. just pick the bottom up and push it toward the top. I like the fact that the seat rows back and forth, gives you a lot more work out accessibility. Even if you want to lift heavy, there is enough weight on there to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon T

customer_reviews.title: Condition and Support
customer_reviews.text: Box was very heavy, but was not shipped on a pallet. Therefore it arrived damaged. Upon unpacking, damage was revealed – scored pain in multiple locations, puncture hole in accessory basket, and a critical bolt is missing. I have reached out to support and have received no response by email, and waited over an hour on their support line with no answer. Complex to assemble. Took half a day.
customer_reviews.author: -MK- Kilburn

customer_reviews.title: Well made with a lot of exercise options.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 65 so wanted a versatile exercise machine that is safe (versus free weights) to work muscle groups. The bowflex is very well made and offers a full range of exercises for upper body and legs. I've only had it a couple weeks so still adjusting to its use. My 30 year old son also uses it and likes it alot. For a serious muscle head/weight lifter building mass (such as a young football player) I would prefer or recommend a more traditional machine with weight stacks but for a light weight machine in your home the bowflex blaze is a good option.
customer_reviews.author: Hulk

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment of all Time!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 53, 6'3" 260 lbs. (was 270) Took me 2 hours to assemble by myself. Works great! In a weeks time with dedication I already lost an immediate 5 pounds with toning results. Soreness is minimum unlike traditional weights and barbells that forces longer recoveries (for older folks with goals). You can work out everyday. I suggest 5 Sets 20 reps of whatever exercise in all regimens incorporating Super Sets. Not the best resistance for the legs to get that shock they need, however this machines accommodates all the prescribes movements to hits all dimensions for every aspect of legs muscles. Super Great Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Clae

product_meta.title: Bowflex Home Gym Series
feature_bullets: Offers over 50 gym quality exercises to work out your entire body
Provides as little as 5 or as many as 210 pounds of power rod resistance
Multi use hand grip or ankle cuffs designed to add flexibility and performance to any workout using the quick change power rod system
Heavy duty steel construction frame offering long term durability

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
